author: Lego_Fan
title: Pretty Cool
review: This set is cool, seeing it's size. My brother got it as a present. It is comprised of a small mining car with a trailer, and an alien with a jet pack.  The car is a cockpit, with a missile and satelite dish on top, plus the sides open to reveal a mini-lab. You can also store a walkie-talkie on the side. The trailer has two small posts to brace it if the car is disconnected, along with a drill and a small chainsaw. Overall, a pretty good set. :)

author: Hedgehog87
title: Strange Set!
review:
I saw this at a store recently, and bought it. Its is strange set, and the alien has a weird jet pack. I'll get to the pros and cons.

Pros: I like how the alien isn't helpless.
      It has a pretty sturdy design
      It comes with a mini lab!
      It has a cute crystal droid!

Cons: It is somewhat smaller than I thought it would be.
      It's almost defenseless.
      The rocket and satellite fall off easily.

Overall, its a odd set, but not my favorite.

author: GSX_R_4S2
title: BUY THIS
review:
This would have to be the greatest cheap set in the history of Lego. Normally I would do a two-in-one review for the alien and human ships, but I'll include it in this one.

Positives

What's not to like? Well, a couple things, but mainly this set is the bomb. The front looks really good (reminds me of that police tank in the World City police station) and the sides match. The satellite and the missile work good with the set, and it even has a place to put a little radio. The lab inside looks great, and it can hold a crystal in it. As for the trailer, the mining arm works great, and the satellite/land pads look perfect. I really like that mini robot on the back that can carry the crystal. Now on to the jetpack. It really fits onto the alien, and it fits the color scheme of the alien ships. It also looks really smooth and stuff, and not clunky like other letpacks Lego has made.

Negatives

Uh...Oh, well the side doors don't cover the lab pieces, so you san see analysis thingies when its meant to be closed. There's a hole in the back that should have been filled with a 2x2x3 brick. Only complaint on the trailer is that the mining arm does not go far enough. And no real complaints on the jetpack.

This is still the all-time best less than 20$ set ever, and probably will be for a while.

author: Legowarroir
title: Cool set
review:
This set is cool. It has two vehicles that can be detaiched. It comes with one astronaut, an alien with a jetpack and a little robot. On the sides of the vehicle it opens up to put crystals in.

                        Pros

                        The vehicles.

                        Cons

                        The alien looks weird.

author: Rgijaba
title: shouldnt miner be driving it...?
review: this set (for the price) is AMASING! it comes with: claw tank driver, and an alien with a jet pack! it also has a little satealite dish thing on the top, and i  think the trailer is also a nice addion to the set, havin little ground scanning dishes on it, i just with LEGO could have made pices that clip on better... the "lab" is just two cool trans black bars with some pretty cool stickers on it! theres also a rocket launcher, and a drill with some supplies... the cute little mini robot is simple yet (in my opinion) is the BEST part of the set! i think his h=name is Q2... could be the next R2! a great set that all you si-fi fans and mars mission fans should try to get! "too bad i dont have any wepons..."   - jet pack alien

author: EL_Mo
title: Pretty nice for the price.
review:
I always base a Lego set on the number of pieces to whether or not it is a good value. In a 10 dollar set, I expect more than 100 pieces, a 20 dollar set more than 200 and so on. This set is a good value containing a whopping 130 pieces. Then I base it on content. Did it get all those pieces from little connectors or are they actually usable? This set over came my expectations. It includes a nice vehicle and a little drilling unit. SO:
Pros:)
+Great playability
+Drill can fold up for easy storage
+Includes a sweet mars mission man (to bad I already have him)
+Great tools

Cons:(
-Stupid trash alien, just throw them off to the side
-Supports for trailer actually raise it, needs modification
-Some wheels do not move all the time

Overall, 9 out of 10!

P.S. this is my original, found out how to get it back sorry

author: Exo_brick
title: Another Great Mars Mission Set!
review:
The box almost kept me from getting it,I'm glad it didn't!

Pros:
-130 pieces for 10.00$! Dirt cheap!
-Rocket produces defense.
-Mini mining robot.
-Drilling trailer is great (btw,those are supports,not sattilites!)
-The guy has a nice face.

Cons:
-White bricks on the bottom of the trailer fall off too much.

Overall 10/10.

author: Takeshi
title: Keep on drilling!
review:
This set was well built, nice and sturdy, and has a neat mini-drone.

Pros- comes with detachable drill pod and mini-drone, and a lab in the main vehicle. The alien has a neat little jetpack.

Cons- there are stickers...

author: Flex
title: Neat Little Set!
review:
I got this cool little set a few days ago. $10 for 130 pieces, you really can't go wrong with this one. I includes alot more then the picture shows. It has a cool driver, a small lab vehicle, a trailer with a drill, a mini robot, and lots of accessories. (satalite dish, walkie-talkie, saw, 3 crystals, rocket) The alien has a jet pack.

Pros:
-Lots of usefull pieces
-Alien isn't helpless
-Lots of accessories
-Finally a MM vehicle not centered arount the alien capture capsule thingy.

Cons:
-Trailer looks somewhat thrown together.

In response to other people who reviewed this set:
-Yes, those are stabilizers on the trailer, not satalite dishes.
-The wheels will move fine if you take the 2x2 round piece off of the bottom.

author: chrisdog121411
title: cool  set
review: this set is the bomb meaning it's a really awesome set.  i like the glow-in-the-dark alien fig you can open the doors on the side and see the jewel. but there are some stickers.the jet pack on the alien is cooler then the human and theres a mining thing on the back. bottom line is this is one heck of a set

author: astropilot13

author: Kapoka79
title: Cool set
review:
This set is a very good Mars Mission one if you are looking to build   up and army of mining vehicles. It's also good priced for being $10 in the U.S.

Pros

It comes with a cool alien mini fig with a jet pack.
It comes with a cool astronaut mini fig.
It comes with a mining vehicle and a mobile one that can hook up to the back of the other one.
Inside it has a experiment lab with a crystal in it.
The cockpit is cool and folds up to open it.
Some of the pieces are pre-painted and you don't have to use that many stickers.
The second piece to the mining vehicle in the back is a drill that mies and it also has a little rover that can pick up crystals.

Cons

There's nothing really wrong with this set as far as I know.

The drill unit and the alien , i feel are just to make up of piece number. they are poorly designed and there ain't enough detail in them. The drill unit for example are like bits and pieces thrown together!

the mini robot however is kind cool!

author: andy87
title: Wow, cool set
review:
When I first saw this set on the internet, I thought it was a hoax made by some crazed fan, but then i went to toys r us and saw it (and the switch fighter) and promptly bought both. I am not disappointed.

Pros:
Largest mobile miner of them all, if I'm not mistaken
includes much more then seen in the picture
The price is a steal, I've seen $20 sets with the same amount of pieces
Alien isn't helpless, he has a jetpack unique to this set
Sturdy design
Comes with a crystal droid which is like the human equivelent of the alien droid on the back of the alien infiltrator


Cons:
A little smaller then i thought
Alien, despite having a jetpack, has no weapon to speak of
So, how is the miner going to defend itself with only one rocket?

This set is fun and cheap overall, buy it if you can

author: rocketscience20
title: COOL!
review:
this is a great set. it has a nice lab section, and i like the mining platform and mini rover. It also has a great alien jetpack, and a nice minifig. It has cool accesories to, a walkie-talkie and a buzzsaw. the rocket and antenna are nice too. overall, this is a great set.If lego hadnt discontinued it, i would reccomend it to people.

P.S. the arms on the side of the mining platform are NOT sattelites. they are stabilizing arms, like they have on cranes.

jetpack alien has no weapons

otherwise, extremely good!

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Space (Mars Mission) - MT Mobile Mining Unit
review:
The MT-21 Mobile Mining Unit (7648) is a LEGO Space (Mars Mission) set which came out in 2008. It comes with 2 minifigs and 130 pieces. This set does include a few decals and there're no mistakes in the instructions and no missing pieces.

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/7648-1.jpg[/img]


Minifigures:

Astronaut: The astronaut comes with a white uniform, white pants, white arms, a gray belt, a white helmet and a golden visor. His torso is double-printed and on his face you can see that he has some shades and a beard.

Alien: The alien is not my favourite minifig which LEGO did. The head and the arms don't move. Only the legs can be moved but they don't move separately. I think the LEGO Space (Life On Mars) aliens are much better than the LEGO Space (Mars Mission) aliens. The alien also has a jetpack which is very nice.

MT-21 Mobile Mining Unit:

The MT-21 mobile mining unit is a very nice set and was very easy to build. The transparent orange windscreen does lift up and you can see the controls in the inside of this vehicle. On each side you can find orange wheels and on the top is a radar which sviwels. The doors on each side can be opened and you can see a gem inside the truck. On the back you're able to find a walkie-talkie. There's also a missile on the top of the rig as well.

The truck also has a trailer which has a driller and a base on each side which do sviwel. The driller is from the LEGO BIONICLE Turaga Whenua set and it's nice to see that piece in this set. The trailer can be detached of the rig and behind the trailer is a little rover vehicle as well. All in all I think it's a fun set and it's very sturdy too. This vehicle is a nice addition to your LEGO Space (Mars Mission) collection.

Positive:

Great pieces which you can use for brickfilms or MOC's
Minifigs


Negative:

It has some stickers
The Mars Mission aliens are not the best


All in all this set is a great model and I would recommend you to get this. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full galery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion
Review

author: patch
title: lab, drill, and cute little robot!
review:
Hi everyone!

 

this is an interesting little set, and something different to huge spaceships with about twenty weapons! it's a mining unit (hence the name) and a laborotary.

Don't be fooled by the picture next to this review, it also has a detachable drilling trailer, an alien with a jetpack, and a mini robot.

 

main lab:

pros:

  • opening cab and side doors
  • radar
  • missile launcher, which although is only a missile on a stick, is a nice touch.
  • radio
  • you can insert a crystal or an alien into the lab.
  • clips onto drill unit

cons:

  • no cons!

drill unit:

pros:

  • circular saw
  • drill , which is nice and simple
  • clip for mini robot
  • stabilising legs/ground scanners

cons:

  • no cons!

mini robot:

pros:

  • cute!
  • can pick up crystals

cons:

  • no cons!

alien with jetpack

basically, this is an alien glow in the dark minifig with a jetpack that holds a crystal. Not much to say really.

 

overall, this is a great little set that is great to add to your mars mission collection at a good price and plenty of playability.

 

hope you found this helpful!

 

Patch.

author: Sobel
title: Why can't I give half stars? This one has potential for more, but can't quite do it.
review:
After having finished my first complete series review (check them out, if you like), I have made it some sort of a good routine for myself to review some sets of my collection in my free time. And with that and my deep passion for LEGO Space, I'll go on to review this space-themed series from the late 2000's.
Now this set is quite interesting, since it has some functions and good playability, even though being made of few pieces. But there also some negative points which had me swaying between three and four stars. In the review, I'll show why I went for three in the end.

Parts

Simple, standard parts for a vehicle, some bricks and joints, nothing too special. The large orange cockpit is OK, as is the drill. There is an annoying amount of stickers, twelve al in all. This is just too much for such a small set and a HUGE negative point for me. Especially because the stickers all tend to peel of after several years, even though not being played with much.

Minifigures

An astronaut and an alien are included in this set. The astronaut has a communications device and a buzz saw at his disposal. The ugly green alien makes use of the hole in his body, having a buildable jetpack attached to its body via the hole.

The build

Simple, brick-on-brick build. First the "truck", then the "trailer". Again, the applying all the stickers while building is a huge pain in the... You know where. But it's still a simple, fast build of approx. 15 minutes max.

The completed model

Even though having little more parts that the MT-31 Trike, this set comes out smaller than the other. Still, it has clearly more functions. The cockpit can be opened, the hatches to both sides, too. Inside is some kind of mini-laboratory to analyze the crystals. The roof has a communications dish and a single rocket launcher. A mobile comm device is attached to the side of the vehicle.
The trailer has two arms, which can be lowered to serve as some kinds of earth anchor, when the drill is in use. The drill is attached to a small, extendable arm which reaches a little further than the end of the trailer. It can't be rotated, though. In the back of the trailer, a small robotic vehicle with a single claw arm is attached. 
The alien has a buildable jetpack to attack from the sky.

Overall opinion

Now, as mentioned in the beginning, I was unsure, wether to give this set 3 or 4 stars. For such a small set, it has quite some functions, as described above. That's why I gave it a higher rating in playability, for there's quite some action a kid can have with this set alone. And, of course, it's a perfect addition to any LEGO Space collection.
But there are quite some flaws, at least IMHO. First up, the stickers. Seriously? Eleven stickers on a set of 130 pieces?!? Ridiculous. Next, the cockpit. No Levers, no monitors, no controls, nothing. Cheap. The single rocket on the roof looks so misplaced, why not just scrap it? The tow coupling between the two parts is WAY too small, the whole vehicle can't make any sharp turns because the wheels collide with each other. And the drill-arm would have been much better with a mechanism to rotate the whole thing.
So, I would have gone for 3.5 stars for creativity and playability, but since that is not possible, the mentioned flaws pull this set down to 3 stars for me. Still, a nice set for younger kids, but nothing of interest for an AFOL.
